findings.rationale: The ability of either party to terminate with only 30 days notice may leave the other party vulnerable to sudden contract termination.
findings.evidence_quote: Either party may terminate this Agreement with 30 days written notice for any reason.

findings.rationale: Limiting liability to the total fees paid in the previous 12 months may not adequately cover potential damages, exposing parties to significant risk.
findings.evidence_quote: Each party's liability is limited to the total fees paid in the 12 months preceding the claim.

findings.rationale: Capping indemnification at annual subscription fees may not provide sufficient protection against larger claims or damages.
findings.evidence_quote: each party indemnifies the other for its own breach, capped at annual subscription fees.

findings.rationale: Confidentiality obligations lasting only 18 months after termination may not be sufficient for sensitive information.
findings.evidence_quote: Confidentiality obligations continue for 18 months after termination.
